title: Heather Watson's Injury Setback and Australian Open Absence
summary: Heather Watson, a 33-year-old British tennis player, has confirmed she will miss the Australian Open this month due to a tendon injury in her glute muscle, which has kept her out of competition since August 2025. This marks her first major injury in her 17-year professional career, causing her world ranking to drop to 269th and her British ranking to ninth. Watson last competed in the US Open qualifying round and has not played since, with her most recent match at Wimbledon in July. Currently, she is undergoing winter training in Florida and has expressed on Instagram that she misses the purpose and challenge of tennis. She aims to return to the tour by the end of February, stating that missing the Australian Open has been emotionally difficult but has fueled her determination to come back stronger. Watson, known for winning the mixed doubles at Wimbledon in 2016, is focused on recovery and resuming her career.
